thread.title: Phillipsburg boys soccer team holds off Vernon, advances to H/W/S semis
thread.title_full: Phillipsburg boys soccer team holds off Vernon, advances to H/W/S semis

title: Phillipsburg boys soccer team holds off Vernon, advances to H/W/S semis
text:
Complete Box Score » 
Phillipsburg 2, Vernon 1 – Rapid Recap 
Phillipsburg High School’s boys soccer team punched its ticket to the Hunterdon/Warren/Sussex semifinals with a 2-1 victory over sixth-seeded Vernon on Saturday at the Phillipsburg Athletic Complex. 
Turning point : The third-seeded Stateliners got off to an exceptional start when Noah Long ’s shot was redirected into the net by Joe Takacs , giving the home team a 1-0 lead after just two and a half minutes. 
Top performer : There were plenty of solid performances, including those by Long and Takacs, but senior Keegan Halloran stood out. He consistently won the ball in the middle of the field and sparked dangerous attacks before eventually leaving the game late in the second half after being banged up on a tackle. 
Halloran also converted a penalty kick, after Takacs’ header off a corner kick drew a handball, with 25:20 remaining in the first half. 
What it means : The Stateliners advance to a county semifinals date at Newton on Oct. 24. Newton, the second seed, defeated Hunterdon Central in penalty kicks on Saturday. 
Phillipsburg continues its quest for its second county title in program history after the disappointment of falling to North Hunterdon in last year’s championship game.
